name: Achiote Chicken
instructions: Throw into a blender 6 cloves of garlic, a quarter of an onion, juice of half an orange and half a lime, 1 habanero (or to taste), and 50g of achiote paste. Add salt and pepper to taste. Apply this marinade to the chicken (around 4lbs) and let it sit for 30 minutes, or overnight if possible. Fry on pan and enjoy!

name: Bacon Beans
instructions: Cook 4 strips of bacon, chopped into small bite-size pieces. Take the bacon strips off the pan but keep half the bacon fat on the pan. Cook 1 onion sliced in the bacon fat until soft and tranlucent. Make sure to salt to make it water faster. Then add 1 jalapeno, 1 can of black beans and 1/2 cup of chicken stock. nThrow the bacon back in and let it simmer until most of the chicken stock has evaporated. Finally, add some butter (2 tbsp) to make it creamy.

name: Cilantro Salsa
instructions: Roast 5 jalapenos, and toss it into a blender with 4 cloves of garlic, juice of 1 lime, and 1 bunch of cilantro. Mix 1 part mayonnaise (kewpie preferred), 2 parts sour cream, and 3 parts blender mix. Blend again and enjoy!

name: Oyster Mushroom Scallops
instructions: Slice the king oyster mushrooms into scallop-sized pieces and score the top and bottom. Cook in pan on medium heat, sprinkle with minced garlic and baste with butter. Once both sides are browned, take off the pan and top off with lime or lemon. Should be soft and taste like scallops! :D

name: Korean Pot Chicken
instructions: Prep the 4 oz Korean potato noodles in boiling or warm water for 20 minutes while we prep the pot. Bring 1 cup of water to a boil and add 1/2 cup of soy sauce, 2 tbsp oysters sauce, 1/4 cup brown sugar (white sugar is fine), 1/4 cup corn syrup, 6 cloves of garlic, 1 tsp pureed ginger  and 1 tsp ground black pepper into the pot. Add 3 lbs of chicken and chilis into the pot and cook until the chicken is mostly cooked. Then, add the onions and carrots to the pot, stir and recover for 8 minutes on medium heat. Then add the potatoes until the vegetables are tender, should take about 5 minutes. Serve and enjoy!

name: Simple Costco Sammy
instructions:
You can grab all these ingredients from Costco! But of course, feel free to use any other options.
    Slice a Costco crossaint in half, and add sandwich ham, cheese (havati preferred), and any other veggies you can think of. My personal preference is arugula, sliced onions, and sliced jalapenos.
    Throw it onto a panini grill until cheese melts nicely. Enjoy!
